# application(_:didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithError:)

**Instance Method**

Tells the delegate that the app was unable to register for Apple Push Services.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func application(_ application: NSApplication, didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithError error: any Error)
```

## Parameters

- **application**: The application that initiated the remote-notification registration process.
- **error**: An NSError object that encapsulates information why registration did not succeed. The application can display this information to the user.

## Discussion

The delegate receives this message after the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/registerForRemoteNotifications(matching:)] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication] is invoked and there is an error in the registration process.

For more information about how to implement push notifications in your application, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Conceptual/RemoteNotificationsPG/index.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008194].

## Handling Push Notifications

- **application(_:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken:)**: Tells the delegate that the app registered for Apple Push Services.
- **application(_:didReceiveRemoteNotification:)**: Tells the delegate when the app receives a remote notification.
